sentence.text: By now they had reached the end of the Gardens , and found several people admiring the view across the river .
He and Sinead had no opportunity to admire the view ; they had been ordered into the hold to hide them from prying eyes .
There were numerous tourists admiring the incredible views but to Ruth there was no one in the world but Fernando .
Freed from the necessity to concentrate on the road , she could have admired the sweep of the rolling scenery of broad fields dotted with cattle , and tree-crowned hills .
She mixed with the villagers , admired their cottage gardens , learned their crafts , and made some of her own gardening tools at the blacksmith 's forge .
Out of the window , Daisy admired the incredibly tidy garden .
` I was merely admiring the garden .
` We were admiring your garden , " says Denis , the candidate 's minder , to the lady on the step .

Afterwards they drank coffee on the terrace , Antonio admiring the garden and pointing out to Susanna a cannonball tree , its cream- and pink-coloured blossoms softly illuminated in the light from a carefully concealed spotlight .
She thumb-cocked the piece , and stood back , admiring her handiwork .
As I stood back to admire my handiwork , Jefferson stood back , shaking his head in disappointment .
They were up there admiring the sunset but I wanted to stop while there was still a bit of light .
Auguste was admiring the famous series of paintings intended for Madame du Barry .
In a busy Art room , Basil bent over to admire a painting by a second-year girl .
Robbie had time to admire the rich patina of lovingly cared-for wood .
Come and tickle its tiny toes and admire its baby-blue eyes !
Just sit and admire the surrounding beauty
